TemplateCategory.Name: 1-key
TemplateCategory.Comments: These templates are composed of a single key. If any of these templates conflict with single letter variables that you use frequently, you can move them individually to a disabled folder, or you can disable all templates in this category by clicking the green check box to the left of the "1-key" category node.

Template.Comment: /* */ Comment

TemplateCategory.Name: Comments
TemplateCategory.Comments: These templates add comments to the code. Nearly all of these templates start with the "/" character.

TemplateCategory.Name: Misc.
TemplateCategory.Comments: Miscellaneous comment templates, including "/t" (Translate) and "/dnt" (Do Not Translate), used to mark strings for translation.

Template.Comment: Generates a /* */ comment. See also: "." 1-key template

Template.Name: /dnt
Template.Comment: A comment to indicate that strings on this line should not be localized. Includes the "MLHIDE" keyword recognized by the Multi-Language add-in.

TemplateCategory.Name: Tasks
TemplateCategory.Comments: Templates for adding TODO tasks and marking problem areas of the code.

Template.Name: /b
Template.Comment: Comment a bug in the code to address later.

Template.Name: f
Template.Comment: Declares a function.

Template.Name: n?JType?
Template.Comment: Creates a new instance of the specified type.

Template.Name: v
Template.Comment: Declares a variable.

TemplateCategory.Name: Program Blocks
TemplateCategory.Comments: Templates in this category generate program blocks that can be used inside methods and property accessors.

TemplateCategory.Name: Else blocks
TemplateCategory.Comments: Templates in this category generate Else blocks. Nearly all of these templates start with the letter "L". Many of these templates string together powerful combos. For example, "sn" sets the identifier on the clipboard to null. "lsn" creates the "else" keyword, and then sets the identifier on the clipboard to null.

Template.Name: blb
Template.Comment: block - else - block (useful after an if-expression)

TemplateCategory.Name: Flow
TemplateCategory.Comments: Templates in this category generate code that controls program flow. This includes loops (while, for, foreach, etc.), switch statements, and flow breakage (e.g., throw exceptions, return, break, continue, etc.).

Template.Name: #CaseStatement#
Template.Comment: Generates a Case block -- called from the switch template.

Template.Name: #ForLoopRouter#
Template.Comment: Expands the MainForLoop template with the correct upperBound, based on context.

Template.Name: #IteratorVar#
Template.Comment: A linked iterator variable of the for-loop.

Template.Name: #MainForLoop#
Template.Comment: System template that expans to a for-loop. The iteratorVar and upperBound variables should be set before calling.

Template.Name: bk
Template.Comment: C# code block

Template.Name: bk,
Template.Comment: C# code block

Template.Name: do
Template.Comment: do - while loop

Template.Name: dw
Template.Comment: do - while loop

Template.Name: fr?IteratorVar?
Template.Comment: For loop. The mnemonic following the "fr" indicates the iterator variable to use in the loop (try i, j, k, ix, and c).

Template.Name: wi
Template.Comment: With block

TemplateCategory.Name: If blocks
TemplateCategory.Comments: Templates in this category generate if blocks. Most start with "if", however a few start with "in", which will lead to "if (!...)" blocks.

Template.Name: cod
Template.Comment: Create on demand

Template.Name: ifa
Template.Comment: if assigned

Template.Name: ifb
Template.Comment: if block

Template.Name: ifn
Template.Comment: if not

Template.Name: ifna
Template.Comment: if not assigned

Template.Name: inr
Template.Comment: if not assigned (or if false) then return

Template.Name: inr"
Template.Comment: if not assigned then return an empty string

Template.Name: inr0
Template.Comment: if not assigned then return zero

Template.Name: inrf
Template.Comment: if not assigned then return false

Template.Name: inrn
Template.Comment: if not assigned then return null

Template.Name: inrt
Template.Comment: if not assigned then return true

Template.Name: inx
Template.Comment: if not assigned then exit (return)

TemplateCategory.Name: Returning Values
TemplateCategory.Comments: Templates in this category return values. These templates all start with the letter "r", and end with one or two characters that describe the value to return. For example, "rf" returns false.

TemplateCategory.Name: try...
TemplateCategory.Comments: Templates in this category generate try/finally and try/catch blocks. These templates all start with the letter "t".

Template.Name: tcf
Template.Comment: try/catch/finally

Template.Name: tfb
Template.Comment: Try/Finally block toggles boolean on the clipboard.

TemplateCategory.Name: Setting Values
TemplateCategory.Comments: Templates in this category all begin with the letter "S" and work with an identifier copied to the clipboard

Template.Name: sbt
Template.Comment: Set Boolean Toggle (toggles the state of the boolean identifier on the clipboard)

Template.Name: sn"
Template.Comment: Need to clear the InString context

TemplateCategory.Name: System
TemplateCategory.Comments: This category contains system templates that are referenced by other templates. Changing these will impact all templates with aliases to them.
